itemDescription: British milliner, fashion designer and socialite

wikipedia_page.main: Nick Smith (born 9 November 1979 in Liverpool, England) is a British milliner, fashion designer and socialite.

response: The Adolphus has been the host of many respected leaders of business, government and entertainment, including presidents, from Warren G. Harding to George H. W. Bush.  Elizabeth II and Prince Philip also stayed at the hotel in 1991. Acclaimed British Milliner Nick Smith resided at the hotel for several months in 2007 to write his début novel "Rock Royalty: Diary of a Supermodel". This hotel was a Dallas hub for entertainment and provided a platform that helped developing careers, such as Bob Hope, Jack Benny and others.  North American Aviation (P-51 Mustangs, World War II) and others benefitted from its position as a Texas business hub.
*Nick Smith (British politician) (born 1960), Labour Member of Parliament for Blaenau Gwent
*Nick Smith (American politician) (born 1934), American congressman from Michigan
*Nick Smith (New Zealand politician) (born 1964), Member of Parliament for Nelson
*Nick Smith (milliner) (born 1981), British socialite, designer, author, recording artist, actor and philanthropist
*Nick Smith (footballer, born 1984), Australian rules football player for Melbourne
*Nick Smith (footballer, born 1988), Australian rules football player for the Sydney Swans
*Nick Smith (Home and Away), character in the Australian television soap opera Home and Away
*Nick Smith (ice hockey) (born 1979), Canadian NHL player with the Florida Panthers

The Nick Smith Foundation is an American 501(c)(3) non-profit charitable organization providing information and support to those with eating disorders. It was founded by British milliner, socialite, designer, author, recording artist and actor Nick Smith.

The mission of the Nick Smith Foundation is to "make a difference in the lives of individuals with eating disorders", leading efforts that promote health and well-being through prevention and control of chronic diseases.
